projects.title: Poppy Field
projects.description:
This project was initiated by the very talented graphic designer and illustrator Valentina D'Efilippo.
Based on an infographic from her book, we've build an interactive version of the graph.

First in November 2014, we've launched the website version, and since October 2017 it's part of the permanent exhibition at the Weltmuseum in Vienna, Austria.

Technically speaking, the project uses D3.js library for the SVG custom graph and a set of data from a static CSV file.

projects.title: Le Beau jeu
projects.description:
Le Beau Jeu (The Beautiful Game) by Accept & Proceed and Nico Pigelet celebrated the UEFA Euro 2016 with an infographic of every game. After each match in the tournament, we released via instagram and twitter a graphic which commemorates the game - showing cards given and goals scored.

By 10th July the body of graphics showed a complete visual journey to the final at the Stade de France.

The challenge was to create the poster in "real time" with a cron task and a few servers scripts to generate the images, and then add them instantly to the Website and all the social media accounts.

projects.title: On Cloudventure
projects.description:
On Running contacted me to help them build a microsite for their latest trail running shoe. As a triathlete and On user, I was very excited to help them.

This website runs bits of SVG to add some details, and a simple JSON file for each language.

projects.title: eGullPay Dashboard
projects.description:
eGull is a startup that created a product for golf and golf players. The product is build in two parts.
1. a mobile app for players so they can track their rounds and pay as they go, for each hole played.
2. The dashboard for golf managers that allows to allow and manage each round.

I worked on the dashboard from scratch, creating the structure and linking it to the REST API, built by the backend developer. I've also coded custom tools for admin settings and drawing on maps.

projects.title: Edwin Jeans
projects.description: I've build most of the front-end for the new Edwin online store. It is meant to be a visual shopping experience for an innovative denim brand.

projects.title: MANifest Hermès
projects.description:
Soixante circuits contacted me to help them build the interface on an interactive booth they've build for Hermès.
The interface let you write a poem using selected words and then you recite it while being filmed, using a face-detection library we were able to display the words as they were being said. You could then share your poem to the world via a generated gif sent to you.

The outside screen allows the visitor to relive all the previous poems.

projects.title: Run the weather
projects.description:
Accept and Proceed have been asked by Nike to put together a visual exploration project for a series of talks they were hosting in Portland.
A&P started working on an idea of generating poster for run activities crossed with weather data.

Then they contacted me to build those posters using Nike+ API data and a weather API. So I've build a support website for people to connect to their Nike+ account and generate (with SVG) the posters.
A&P also displayed the poster in their private exhibition place for a few weeks.

(the website is offline for now due to Nike policy of giving access to their API to third parties.)

projects.title: Dagomatch
projects.description:
Dagomatch is a mobile recruitment campaign website. The idea is to answer a few questions by theme selected - that matches your professional profile.
As a result you get a percentage match and you can apply to a job via this website.

I've build the website with VueJS and added some SVG animated transitions.

projects.title: Social Wall
projects.description:
Soixante circuits (along with Headoo, Auditoire and Bonhomme) built a social wall for Coca Cola in the AccorHotel Arena (the biggest indoor entertainment arena in Paris).
I've helped them polished the details on the final interface using web technologies, NodeJS and Javascript mainly.

projects.title: Marie Laurent
projects.description: I've build Marie Laurent's portfolio, she is a very talented art director, graphic designer and illustrator based in Paris.

projects.title: Kantar
projects.description:
Kantar is home to some of the world's leading research, data and insight companies. We've build a corporate website for them.

The website is fully responsive and uses Backbone JS and the underscore template engine. I work closely with the back-end developer to create the SEO-friendly no-javascript version.

projects.title: Restaurant Le Duc
projects.description:
Restaurant Le Duc is one of the finest fish and seafood restaurant in Paris.
Marie Fiorucci, a very talented art director - and friend - asked me to help her build the website.
I've done this using Wordpress for a simple backend and a fully customized front-end.

projects.title: Gilles Marchal
projects.description:
Gilles Marchal is one of the most famous french chef patissier.
Marie Fiorucci, a very talented art director - and friend - asked me to help her build the website.
I've done this using Wordpress for a simple backend and a fully customized front-end.

projects.title: Mindshare
projects.description:
Mindreader is a subset of Mindshare. The client wanted to create a website to present monthly question answered by people from all over the world.

We've build a simple interface that allows the user to compare the countries/regions of the world up to 4 simultaneously. I built it using SVG and RaphaelJS.

projects.title: Kick it to Brazil
projects.description:
On the website #kickittobrazil you can follow the journey of a football around the world. From Paris to Rio, during 60 days, you can see instagram and facebook posts during the travel and watch the daily videos. You can also influence the journey with votes and post your own photos to support the amazonian forrest.

The website is fully responsive and uses Backbone+Marionette JS and the underscore template engine.
I've also build the backend with scripts scanning different social networks (twitter, facebook and instagram) to get the hashtag #kickittobrazil.
